pullRequest.title: Tck
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (please use '[x]' to check the checkboxes, or submit the PR and then click the checkboxes)

 The commit message follows our guidelines
 Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
 Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

Does this PR already have an issue describing the problem ? If so, link to this issue using '#XXX' and skip the rest
NO
What kind of change does this PR introduce? (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)
Feature
What is the current behavior? (You can also link to an open issue here)
iidm-impl tests can't be reused
What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?
iidm-impl tests can be reused
Does this PR introduce a breaking change or deprecate an API? If yes, check the following:
NO
Other information:
The tests are extracted to a new module iidm/iidm-tck. tck means Technology Compatibility Kit. The name "tck" is used by java itself and by know java projects (e.g. https://github.com/reactive-streams/reactive-streams-jvm/tree/master/tck ).
In a second pass, it could be valuable to choose more precisely which tests that originally came from iidm-impl should be in this tck.  Here all the tests that could be written to use only the iidm-api have been moved without much more thought.
This PR requires #1119 to be run in other projects

beforeCommit.message:
Move Validable, ValidationException and ValidationUtil to iidm-api, Extract iidm-impl tests in a tck

Some tests that are too tied to the implementations
are not yet moved

Signed-off-by: Jon Harper <jon.harper87@gmail.com>

afterCommit.message:
Move Validable, ValidationException and ValidationUtil to iidm-api, Extract iidm-impl tests in a tck

Some tests that are too tied to the implementations
are not yet moved

Signed-off-by: Jon Harper <jon.harper87@gmail.com>

commit.message:
Move Validable, ValidationException and ValidationUtil to iidm-api, Extract iidm-impl tests in a tck

Some tests that are too tied to the implementations
are not yet moved

Signed-off-by: Jon Harper <jon.harper87@gmail.com>

fix sonar issues

don't disable sonar on iidm-tck

nodes.bodyText: Is it necessary to specify this scope? it's the default value, isn't it?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<!--
+
+    Copyright (c) 2017, RTE (http://www.rte-france.com)
+    This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
+    License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
+    file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
+
+-->
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>com.powsybl</groupId>
+        <artifactId>powsybl-iidm</artifactId>
+        <version>3.2.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+    </parent>
+
+    <artifactId>powsybl-iidm-tck</artifactId>
+    <name>IIDM TCK</name>
+    <description>The IIDM Technology Compatibility Kit</description>
+
+    <dependencies>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
+            <artifactId>powsybl-iidm-api</artifactId>
+            <version>${project.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+
+        <!-- Test dependencies -->
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>com.google.jimfs</groupId>
+            <artifactId>jimfs</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
+            <artifactId>log4j-over-slf4j</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
+            <artifactId>powsybl-commons</artifactId>
+            <version>${project.version}</version>
+            <type>test-jar</type>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
+            <artifactId>powsybl-config-test</artifactId>
+            <version>${project.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
+            <artifactId>powsybl-iidm-test</artifactId>
+            <version>${project.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>junit</groupId>
+            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
+            <scope>compile</scope>
